2004-08-10 12:56 (link)   Select 
I'm going to make some very very general suggestions Take them or leave them.

1) Unless you are going for some sort of E. E. Cummings effect, don't lowercase your eyes.

2) Always check your spelling. Spell-check loves being used. It gives it a sense of purpose.

3) Avoid cliched images and expressions.

4) Avoid unspecified prepositions.

5) Embrace your nouns and verbs. They are the skeleton and flesh of poetry.

6) Narrate less. Don't tell the audience what you feel or what they should feel. Instead, think up tactile imagery.

7) Revise, revise, revise. It's human nature to think in cliches, to do what's been done before, to say things that have already been said. The task of a poet (or any writer, really) is to get past that and invent new expressions. 

So don't write about bottomless pits if you can write about soap-lined sinks, don't write about aching hearts if you can write the feel of a thumb prodding your celiac plexus, don't write about changing the world if you can write about that time you vomited on your brother's new Nikes that time you had appendicitis.

8) Always be open to criticism, but **never take that criticism as the Word of G-d**.

Best of luck.

So if this world ends,
Will we fall to the bottom
Of the endless pit,
Humanity has created?

Why do they get to make all the choices?
Isn't this my life?
Why do they tell me what i can say,
When i'm the one who holds the future?

You think you know it all,
But you're selfish,
And you'll never know how it feels
To be totally free.

Dont repremand me. 
You know deep down i'll be the one,
Who'll change the world.
Not you and your lies.

So today,
As i stand looking out the window.
I came to realize,
Maybe our love can never be.

I never used to notice,
Just the little things you do.
But now, as i open my eyes,
I dont know where i am.

Are you the person i used to know?
I ask myself too many questions,
But does it hurt you,
To answer me for once?

Why am I this way?
I dont want this feeling to change,
But I dont know what to do,
Is this the end?

Tell me, are you the one for me?
I never used to second guess.
Love has left me jaded,
So tell me, is this the end?

I GOTTED HOME EARLY!!!!!

Well, now it's time to tell you about...

<lj-cut text="my wonderful weekend">

First, i had to get up uuuber early on friday, so i was really tired. We got to the airport by 5, got all checked in, and got on our plane at 6:30 like planned. the flight to san fransico was okay, not to bad. actually pretty nice. my dad had a fit about turning his cell phone off though.

But the flight from san fransico to portland was just fing scary. the aircraft made funny noises, it took half an hour to taxi out, and i had to sit next to strangers because my sister doesn't love me. anyway, we got to portland okay.

then we met my grandma and auntie at the airport. oh my god, my auntie got more and more annoying as the weekend went on -.- I just about wanted to smack her. she wants me to go up to her house for a WHOLE WEEK in august to SCAN PICTURES. >< damn it, no. I want to STAY AT HOME.

Anyway, then we got our rental car (a white van) and headed out to hood river, which is about an hour away from portland. it was really, really pretty up there, with all the trees and the river and how few houses there were by the road. rural. kinda scary, too.

well, we had to stop and shop for wedding prezzies, and then we drove up to our hotel. It was a best western, and very nice. all you had to do was walk out the sliding glass door and there was the river. You could sit there, looking at washington state on the other side. but it was funner to watch the wind surfers wipe out. 

anyway, so that night we went to the rehersal dinner, and it was really, REALLY nice. Way up in the mountains, secluded, and they had really good food. they had a bunch of hornets though. they ate my sisters chicken.

on saturday was the wedding, but my sister stephanie, and my sister in law allie and i all went to a spa for a full body massage before hand. oh my god, it was great. I have never, EVER felt sooo relaxed. mmm -falls over- 

anyway, the wedding was nice. there was no air conditioning in the place where it was, so it was hotter than hell, but it was pretty, with mount hood in the backround. my new sister carrie is sooo pretty. e.e her dress was gorgous. and the reception dinner was good too. and the cake was awesome. xDDD

anyway, today, we had to get up at 8:30 because my grandma and auntie had to be at the airport by ten, even though their flight didn't leave until noon. well, after we dropped them off, we went and ate breakfast, and i had the best omlet of my life. four cheese with tomato, yummy.

anyway, then we got gas and went back to the airport. got out bags checked, but since our original flight wasn't until seven, the lady put us on stand by incase they could get us on an earlier flight. and they did

we left portland at 3:25, and i had to sit next to this girl who smelled like kimchee. now, if you've ever had kimchee, you know how bad it smells. anyway, i had to live with that until san fransico. 

once we got to san fransico, they were able to put us on the 6:25 flight, and we got home at 10 to 8. so i got home about 4 hours before i was originally supposed to. YAAAY!

</lj-cut>

Well, that's about it -falls over- I'VE MISSED YOU ALL SO MUCH. GIVE ME LOVES..
